column3: str
Oh, greetings, my <hex:02080FE905FF05>lady<hex:FF05>lord<hex:03>! We're in the midst of preparing a new initiative for our friends of the Firmament. We ask for your patience meanwhile.
If you're interested in kupo nuts, I'm afraid I cannot assist. But if you're interested in the Kupo of Fortune, you've come to the right place, kupo!
A-Ahem. Please disregard my outfit. I was in the midst of preparing a new initiative for our friends of the Firmament, but it appears I took too long, for Enie then conceived of...this.
If you are interested in kupo nuts, I'm afraid I cannot assist. But if you're interested in the Kupo of Fortune, you've come to the right place, kupo!
If it please you, I shall explain how the game works.
Upon each Kupo of Fortune card, there are four hexagons, each depicting a treasure chest provided courtesy of our moogle friends.
Playing is simple: you scratch open a chest of your choice.
If the chest holds something from first to fourth prize, congratulations! The fabulous item shown on the prize list is yours!
But be fairly warned: a ferocious beast lies in wait for hapless treasure hunters. Should you find a griffin instead, you must console yourself with a consolation prize.
Now, for some important details. The chest on the left holds only second, third, and fourth prizes. Meaning, while you cannot win first prize, neither is there the danger of finding a griffin.

The three chests on the right, meanwhile, can hold any of the four prizes as well as a griffin. Meaning, while you have a chance to reap the richest reward, you may also walk away with a paltry prize. Which side you scratch open is entirely your choice.
As the prizes on offer change each time you play, be sure to cast an eye over the prize list before trying your luck.
That concludes the explanation. If you wish to review the rules, I will post the information to the skybuilders' board, so please refer to it at your leisure.
Oh, and are you aware of our new venture for procuring materials? If not, I urge you to seek out Flotpassant for details.
Oh, and may I ask if you've been informed about exchanging skybuilders' scrips? If not, I urge you to seek out Enie for the details.

If you're interested in kupo nuts, I'm afraid I cannot assist. But if you're interested in the Kupo of Fortune, you've come to the right place, kupo! Will you be trying your luck today, my <hex:02080FE905FF05>lady<hex:FF05>lord<hex:03>?
Oh dear, it appears you don't have a kupo voucher. I suggest you speak with Potkin to see what items you can donate to earn the stamps required.
Oh dear, it seems you have no room in your bag for a prize. But rest assured the Kupo of Fortune will still be here after you've sorted your possessions.
A kupo voucher is required (<hex:022003E80203> remaining). Do you wish to play?
<hex:026003020303>Oho, you've won first prize! Congratulations, kupopo!

You've won <hex:02094DE802FF06>first<hex:FF07>second<hex:FF06>third<hex:FF07>fourth<hex:FF06>fifth<hex:FF06>sixth<hex:FF08>seventh<hex:FF06>eigth<hex:FF06>ninth<hex:FF06>tenth<hex:03> prize! Congratulations, kupo!
Oh dear, it's a griffin... My pom-pom aches for you... But keep your chin up, for there is always another chance to win, kupo!
It appears you have more vouchers. Do you wish to play again?
Whenever you wish to play again, you will find me here!
